raw: * The stack container puts its child widgets on top of each other and only the
* topmost widget is visible.
* This is used e.g. in the tab view widget. Which widget is visible can be
* controlled by using the {@link #getSelection} method.
* *Example*
* Here is a little example of how to use the widget.
* <pre class='javascript'>
*   // create stack container
*   var stack = new qx.ui.container.Stack();
*   // add some children
*   stack.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget().set({
*    backgroundColor: "red"
*   stack.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget().set({
*    backgroundColor: "green"
*   stack.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget().set({
*    backgroundColor: "blue"
*   // select green widget
*   stack.setSelection([stack.getChildren()[1]]);
*   this.getRoot().add(stack);
*
* This example creates an stack with three children. Only the selected "green"
* widget is visible.
* *External Documentation*
* <a href='http://qooxdoo.org/docs/#desktop/widget/stack.md' target='_blank'>
* Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo manual.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The stack container puts its child widgets on top of each other and only the topmost widget is visible. This is used e.g. in the tab view widget. Which widget is visible can be controlled by using the {@link #getSelection} method. Example Here is a little example of how to use the widget. 


   var stack = new qx.ui.container.Stack();

   stack.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget().set({
    backgroundColor: "red"
   }));
   stack.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget().set({
    backgroundColor: "green"
   }));
   stack.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget().set({
    backgroundColor: "blue"
   }));

   stack.setSelection([stack.getChildren()[1]]);
   this.getRoot().add(stack);

This example creates an stack with three children. Only the selected "green" widget is visible. External Documentation Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo manual.

raw: * Returns the index position of the given widget if it is
* a child widget. Otherwise it returns -1.
* This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
* (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
* layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
* ignore the children order for the layout process.
* @param child {qx.ui.core.Widget} the widget to query for
* @return {Integer} The index position or -1 when
*   the given widget is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given widget if it is a child widget. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.Widget} the widget to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given widget is no child of this layout.

raw: * Adds a new child widget.
* The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager
* used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class
* documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.
* @param child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the widget to add.
* @param options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a new child widget. The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the widget to add.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

raw: * Add a child widget at the specified index

* ignore the children order for the layout process.
* @param child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget to add
* @param index {Integer} Index, at which the widget will be inserted
* @param options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.body: Add a child widget at the specified index This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the widget will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

* ignore the children order for the layout process.

* @param options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.
